alert.note: Alert for Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 23 at 9:15AM MDT until April 30 at 4:00AM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Glasgow affecting Valley County. For the Milk River...including Tampico, Glasgow, Nashua...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River at Glasgow. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Water over Whately Road and the baseball field at Sullivan Park starts subsiding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 29.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM MDT Sunday was 29.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Saturday morning and continue falling to 23.8 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.0 feet on 06/22/1921. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday afternoon by 1200 PM MDT.
